problem.display_name: Stabilizer description of quantum circuit transformations
problem.p: Consider the following simple quantum circuit:

The input state is [mathjaxinline]|00\rangle[/mathjaxinline], which is stabilized by [mathjaxinline]{\cal S}_0 = \langle {\tt IZ},{\tt ZI}\rangle[/mathjaxinline]. Give the stabilizers describing the state after the Hadamard and after the controlled-NOT gate.

Work this out by using the fact that [mathjaxinline]U[/mathjaxinline] acting on a state stabilized by [mathjaxinline]{\cal S}[/mathjaxinline] produces a state stabilized by [mathjaxinline]U{\cal S}U^\dagger[/mathjaxinline].

You can also double-check yourself by working out the explicit quantum states produced in the circuit, and figuring out the stabilizers for each of the states. However, for circuits composed of Clifford group gates, namely circuits generated by [mathjaxinline]H[/mathjaxinline], [mathjaxinline]S[/mathjaxinline], and the controlled-NOT gate, it is much faster to work directly with the stabilizer.
Enter each stabilizer as a list of generators, eg [IX,XI]:
